item.title: Practical experience
item.description: Language and linguistics Instructor at the university level: technology in linguistic research (summer semester 2018–summer semester 2019) Copy-editing: Copy-editor (2019–present) at Copernicus Publications, Research Assistant at the Collaborative Research Center 948 (2016–2017), freelance English copy-editor (2017–present) English as a Foreign Language: Instructor (2015–2017), Tutor (2013–2014) Research: German – Research Methods (2013–present), Dialectology (2015), Kiezdeutsch (2014); Menominee – Transcription (2015), Particle Analysis (2012); Japanese - Loanword Phonology (presented at WIGL 2015); Ukrainian – Field Methods (2015); Yoruba – Field Methods (2014) In the fields of language and linguistics, I have been in the classroom as a student and teacher, in the lab as a research assistant, and in the field as a research and educator.

item.title: Education
item.description: Menomonie High School I graduated from Menomonie High School in 2011 as a recipient of the President’s Education Award and World Language Department Award and as a two-time Advanced Placement Scholar with Distinction. I was an active student, having had served on multiple boards at my high school and in my local community, competing numerous times in state-level forensics (competitive speaking) competitions as well as local theater performances and working part-time as a certified nurse aide.
